log.reg.11 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Finding the Betas

    log_betas.Rd

    This function will spit out the desired beta values for the log loss function

    log_betas(Data, Y, X)

    Arguments

    Data

    a matrix of data that we want to do a logistic regression on.

    Y

    A integer representing the column of the data that you want to be the response variable

    X

    A vector representing the column(s) of the data that you want to be the predictor variable(s).

    Value

    A vector giving the optimized beta values

    Author

    Group 11

    Examples

      #data obtained from https://stats.oarc.ucla.edu/r/dae/logit-regression/
  test_data <- read.csv("https://stats.idre.ucla.edu/stat/data/binary.csv")
  test_resp <- 1
  test_pred <- 2:4
  log_betas(Data = test_data, Y = test_resp, X = test_pred)
#> $par
#>              [,1]
#> [1,] -3.440677328
#> [2,]  0.002289743
#> [3,]  0.774910748
#> [4,] -0.559607591
#>

#> [1] 229.7209
